title: AI is doing up to 50% of the work at Salesforce, CEO Marc Benioff says
original_content: Key Points Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff said artificial intelligence is accounting for 30% to 50% of the company's workload. Technology companies are hunting for new ways to trim costs, boost efficiencies and transform their workforce with the help of AI. Benioff estimates that the software company has reached about 93% accuracy with the technology. In this article CRM Follow your favorite stocks CREATE FREE ACCOUNT Marc Benioff, Chairman & CEO of Salesforce, speaking on CNBC's Squawk Box outside the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland on Jan. 22nd, 2025. Gerry Miller | CNBC Salesforce is accelerating its use of artificial intelligence in automating workloads, according to CEO Marc Benioff . "All of us have to get our head around this idea that AI could do things, that before, we were doing, and we can move on to do higher-value work," he said in an interview with Bloomberg , noting that the technology currently accounts for about 30% to 50% of the company's work. Technology companies are hunting for new ways to trim costs, boost efficiencies and transform their workforce with the help of AI. The aftershocks have already hit the tech industry, with the software giant cutting more than 1,000 positions earlier this year as it restructured around AI. Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski said the company has shrunk its headcount by 40% due in part to AI investment, while Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said the e-commerce giant will use artificial intelligence to reduce roles. Benioff called the rise of AI in the workforce a "digital labor revolution," estimating that the software company has reached about 93% accuracy with the technology. "It's pretty good," he said, but it's not "realistic" to hit 100%. He added that other vendors are at "much lower levels because they don't have as much data and metadata" to build higher accuracy. tiktok_summary: This discovery just made the impossible possible: the CEO of Salesforce reveals that AI is doing up to 50% of the company's work. That's right, folks, technology is so advanced that it's taking over the job of some employees. The CEO explains that Salesforce has been using artificial intelligence to automate tasks, achieving an impressive 93% accuracy rate. Imagine having a team of robots working alongside humans, doing all the grunt work. It's not just sci-fi anymore. According to the CEO, AI is now handling about 30% to 50% of the workload. But what does this mean for the future of work? The author claims that technology companies are hunting for ways to trim costs, boost efficiency, and transform their workforce with the help of AI. And it looks like Salesforce is leading the charge. The company's CEO is convinced that AI will continue to play a major role in shaping the industry. Wait, what? You might be thinking, but hear him out. According to the CEO, the key is to focus on high-value tasks that require human ingenuity and creativity. By delegating mundane tasks to AI, humans can concentrate on more complex problems and drive innovation. Here's the kicker that nobody saw coming: did you know that Salesforce is already using AI to personalize customer experiences? They're talking about making customer service more efficient and effective. It's no wonder the CEO believes AI will become increasingly important in the next few years. But what about job displacement? Will AI take over completely? Not quite yet, but it's certainly changing the way we work.
